page.title: 01Thurnham/Sunderland Point
page.content: There is a beautiful unspoiled coastline, river estuary, and grassland used for dairy farming. The salt marshes support an abundance of wild life, plants, and birds. The river is used by pleasure craft and cargo vessels going to/from Glasson Dock. There are shifting sands in the estuary, and some land erosion at both sides of the river due to tidal activity. There are the ruins of Cockersand Abbey, some fine old houses and two lighthouses. There is a bird sanctuary and a site of Special Scientific Interest which are popular with tourists.
